snippet: Jay Bonin embodies what it means to live in service to Caissa, the mythical goddess of chess: he has probably played more tournaments than anyone.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column highlights New York international master Jay Bonin, who has probably played more tournaments than anyone, but whose life has become more tenuous of late.
lead_paragraph: Jay Bonin embodies what it means to live in service to Caissa, the mythical goddess of chess: he has probably played more tournaments than anyone.

headline.seo: Chess: Jay Bonin Says the Game Is an ‘Elixir’
headline.main: A Master’s Setbacks in Life Inspire Success at the Board
headline.print_headline: A Master’s Setbacks in Life Inspire Success at the Board
